content.text:
# King Dao of Zhou

|p2=Zhōu Dào Wáng |w2=Chou Dào-wangKing Dào of Chou |l2=The Mournful King of Zhou
}}
King Dao of Zhou (; died 520 BC), personal name Ji Meng, was a king of the Chinese Zhou dynasty.
Dao succeeded his father, King Jǐng. After a reign of less than a year, he was killed by his brother Prince Zhao (朝). Following King Dao's death, the throne passed to another of his brothers, King Jìng.
See also
* Family tree of ancient Chinese emperors
